basics.name: Jungwoo Park
basics.label: Masters Student at Georgia Tech
basics.summary: Graduate CS student at Georgia Tech specializing in Machine Learning with experience building and deploying deep learning models for sign language translation, user behavior prediction, and LLM evaluation. Strong foundation in Python, PyTorch, and scalable ML pipelines.

education.area: Cognitive Science Specialization in Machine Learning and Neural Computation
courses: Calculus and Analytic Geometry for Science and Engineering

projects.name: A RAG-Powered LLM for Personalized Restaurant Recommendation in Atlanta
projects.summary: Developed a personalized restaurant recommender for Atlanta using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), LLaMA 3, and prompt engineering, combining structured metadata with natural language reviews.
highlights: Implemented RAG with structured and unstructured data fusion
Applied prompt engineering to improve response relevance

projects.name: Exploring Effectiveness of Deep Neural Nets for Korean Word Spacing Problem
projects.summary: Designed and compared deep learning models including Bidirectional LSTM, CNN, and Transformer using PyTorch for solving the Korean word spacing problem.
highlights: Implemented and evaluated Bidirectional LSTM, CNN, and Transformer architectures
Analyzed performance trade-offs for Korean NLP task

projects.name: Detecting User Actions from Mouse Events
projects.summary: Built an ML pipeline to classify real-time user activity using mouse movement logs across varying window sizes.
highlights: Engineered end-to-end pipeline for time-series mouse event data
Compared LightGBM, Random Forest, KNN, LSTM, and K-Means

projects.name: Creating Viable AI Tutor Powered by GPT-4 API
projects.summary: Developed a GPT-4-powered assistant capable of generating interactive study materials, including chatbots, flashcards, cheat sheets, and exams.
highlights: Integrated GPT-4 API with custom UI for enhanced learning experience
Applied prompt engineering to optimize content generation

projects.name: Designing Machine Learning Algorithms for Diabetes Diagnosis
projects.summary: Compared multiple ML algorithms to improve the accuracy of diabetes diagnosis from patient data.
highlights: Evaluated logistic regression, decision tree, k-nearest neighbor, and support vector machines
Performed performance comparison and model selection

Research.location: Department of Computer Science, Georgia Tech
Research.summary: Preprocessed and analyzed the phrase data for training/testing and eventual implementation in the CopyCat game.
highlights: Currently building ML pipeline to do the Seq2Seq phrase to sign matching task and implement model conversion

Research.summary: Understand and benchmark the reasoning efficiency of large language models.
highlights: Devised challenging yet solvable tasks, such as determining the palindrome for GPTmodel, which can be split into two simple and independent tasks to prove that the model cannot decompose complicated tasks into simple ones, even with Chain of Thought (CoT) prompting
Chose efficiency in backward reasoning as the measure of intelligence for large language models

awards.title: Honorable Career
awards.summary: Received Honorable Career for volunteering as an interpreter at Incheon International Airport during COVID-19 pandemic.

awards.title: Grand Prize, 2nd Corps for Gangwon University Start-up Competition
awards.summary: Awarded Grand Prize for innovative project ideas and execution.

awards.title: Top 25 Team for ROK Army Start-up Competition
awards.summary: Placed in the top 25 teams for the ROK Army Start-up Competition, showcasing innovative ideas and solutions.

awards.title: 1st Place, 2nd Army Brigade Start-up Competition
awards.summary: Won 1st place in the 2nd Army Brigade Start-up Competition for outstanding project proposal and execution.
